title: What is the best evidence of intelligent life in outer space? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is none other than the vast number of possibilities with 2 trillion Galaxies in the visible Universe , each with an average of 200 million or more stars. I feel that Intelligent Civilizations may be extremely rare , perhaps 1 in a trillion to 10 trillion Planets on average [ meaning far fewer than one Civilization in every Galaxy ]. We have only been an ‘Advanced Civilization ‘ for about 100 years so we have a limited search time and vast distances between Galaxies and the relatively slow speed of light which answer the ‘ Fermi Paradox ‘ - which starts with the assumption that ‘Advanced Civilizations ‘ are common with dozens or more ‘Civilizations’ per Galaxy. There may even be ‘beacons ‘ or traces of faster than light signals [which we can not yet detect nor understand ] used by ‘Advanced Alien Civilizations ‘ because we are not yet a truly’ Advanced Civilization’ ourselves… For example -I predicted that gravitational waves because they bend space would/could travel at faster than light speeds . This is probably why LIGO measured distant Gravitational Waves from a Neutron Star pair collision - and the gravitational waves arrived slightly earlier than the radiated energy . Truly ‘Advanced Civilizations ‘ may be able to create powerful Gravitational Waves by direct resonance without huge explosions is my point here. ‘They’ also may use quantum entanglement , etc. which we can not detect. ‘They ‘ have probably mastered gravitational fields so they have a local gravity in their ‘ Spacecrafts’ with fail safe layers of opposing gravity ( gravitational plywood) and don’t experience G forces in these craft. They may have re-engineered their bodies to absorb radiation and convert it to energy - and no longer eat , and may have a solid state electrical nervous system , with a photosensitive type exoskeleton . They might look like large metallic insects with complex ‘hands’ to us . There are a growing number of military radar and visual encounters with UFOs by trained pilots which also raise the possibility - but do not prove the existence of intelligent extraterrestrial life. I think if there are enough of these credible recorded radar and visual encounters by pilots over the next 10 years or so , with additional verification, this might change . We have a growing ability to analyze Exoplanet atmospheres and eventually one will be detected with strong evidence of an industrial society ( with isotopes not found in nature , and other chemical signatures ,or perhaps a ‘too clean filtered atmosphere ‘ ) in the next 10 to 50 years , possibly . So far, we have no true scientific evidence , nor proof of extraterrestrial intelligent life, or any life beyond Earth. I think ‘ simple life ‘ will be much more common than the numbers I posted above - and get exponentionally more rare as the complexity of the organism(s) increases. We have merely speculation - like this posted answer.
